summary: Requires General Stores. Adds auto sorting containers to the three hearthfire player homes for quicker and easier storage.
descriptionHtml:
[b][url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/18340/]Powered by General Stores[/url][/b]
You will need to download and install that file first before using this one. I did not create any of the activators in this mod, only placed them in the various homes.

[b]Version 3.0+ Warning![/b]
----------------------------------
All versions moving forward (3.0 and up) will be replacing some of the default storage containers in the homes. Please remove all your storage before installing or upgrading versions! If you don\'t, you will likely lose all of the equipment in the standard containers!

[b]Reasoning[/b]
----------------------------------
I\'m a huge pack rat when it comes to video games and I find general stores makes my life a lot easier. I also like the three new Hearthfire homes. Thus the only logical conclusion is adding the general stores activators to the homes.

[b]What\'s Added[/b]
----------------------------------
This mod adds several storage activators from the General Stores mod to the three Hearthfire houses (I tried to keep them in the same spot). Each activator has been tied to an existing hearthfire furniture group, so they shouldn\'t appear until you\'ve purchased the linked furniture. You should be able to add this mod to existing homes, even if you\'ve added everything. I\'ve also avoided adding anything to the rear main hall room, so it should be compatible with [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/26098]Shezeries[/url] [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/26016]Kitchen[/url] [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/26427]Mods[/url].

I have added or replaced the following activators:

[b]Exterior[/b]
[list][*]Crafting Stores (Kettle Near Bench)
[*]Smelting Stores (Near the smelter; only appears with smelter)
[*]Smithing Stores (Near the armor workbench; only appears with armor workbench)
[*]Tanning Stores (Near the tanning rack; only appears with tanning rack)
[*]Cistern Access (Trap door near front steps)[/list]

[b]Entryway[/b]
[list][*]General Stores ([b]Replaces[/b] chest in Entryway)[/list]

[b]Main Hall (Ground Floor)[/b]
[list][*]Alchemy Stores ([b]Replaces[/b] satchel on table with small display case)
[*]Alchemists Mortar (On the table with the small display case)
[*]Book Stores ([b]Replaces[/b] clutter on fireplace mantle)
[*]Cooked Food Stores (On dining table)
[*]Follower Gear ([b]Replaces[/b] chest under East stairwell)
[*]Food Stores (Pot on Fireplace)
[*]Potion Stores ([b]Replaces[/b] keg on table beneath west stairwell)
[*]Raw Food Stores (On dining table)
[*]Stolen Goods ([b]Replaces[/b] clutter on fireplace mantle)
[*]Treasure Stores ([b]Replaces[/b] chest under West stairwell)[/list]

[b]Main Hall (Upper Floor)[/b]
[list][*]Soul Gem Stores ([b]Replaces[/b] satchel on small round table near the chair and enchanting table)
[*]Scroll Stores ([b]Replaces[/b] book on end table adjacent to armor stand)[/list]

[b]Cellar[/b]
[list][*]Archery Stores ([b]Replaces[/b] archery target)
[*]Armor Stores ([b]Replaces[/b] chest near armoring bench)
[*]Crafting Stores (in front of the forge)
[*]Dragon Claw Display (Replaces low table with goblets; goblets and crate are moved)
[*]Smelting Stores ([b]Replaces[/b] empty crate near smelter)
[*]Smithing Stores (Near the forge anvil)
[*]Tanning Stores ([b]Replaces[/b] pot and bowl on shelf above tanning rack)
[*]Weapon Storage ([b]Replaces[/b] chest near grindstone)[/list]

[b]Installation[/b]
----------------------------------
[b]IMPORTANT:[/b] You  must have [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/18340/]General Stores[/url] installed or this mod won\'t work!
1. Unzip the mod into your Skyrim/Data directory.
2. Activate Hearthfire Sorting.esp with your choice of mod manager.
3. Enjoy!

OR

Install automatically using the Nexus Mod Manager

[b]Version History[/b]
----------------------------------
12/19/2012 - Version 3.1. Added small construction storage chests to each crafting table. Each should be linked to the chest itself, so they\'ll disappear after you remove the crafting table.
12/09/2012 - Version 3.0. I remade the entire mod from the ground up again. This version replaces some storage containers and includes better integration.
11/16/2012 - Version 2.0, now with more containers and the support included in the Hearthfire Automated Storage.
11/15/2012 - Initial Release 1.0

[b]Credits[/b]
----------------------------------
This mod wouldn\'t be possible without the great [url=http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/18340/]General Stores[/url] mod by Harvey2112. All I did was drag and drop his hard work into the player homes. Version 2.0 was built on the background of Hearthfire Automated Storage (http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/25154) by Harvey2112.
author: Save-vs-DM

files.name: Hearthfire Storage
files.changelogHtml:
Rebuilt mod on the back of Hearthfire Automated Storage (http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/25154) by Harvey2112.
Rearranged position of a few cotainers to better fit the house layout.
Removed Archarey rack, added Construction materials chest.
Trapdoor to storage cistern was added.
